#################

**Government Tender Announcement**
=============================

**Request for Standing Offer (RFSO)**
------------------------------

### Description

**RMSO Temporary Help Services**
--------------------------------

The Government of Canada invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the provision of temporary help services to federal government departments and agencies in the Atlantic Region.

This procurement includes a portion set aside for Aboriginal Business under the Federal Government Set-Aside Program for Aboriginal Business.

The procurement requires the provision of temporary help services in one or more of the geographical areas listed in Annex A, Statement of Work, on an as-and-when-requested basis.

### Mandatory Criteria

To be considered for a Standing Offer, Offerors must demonstrate that they meet the following mandatory technical criteria:

1.  The Offeror must have a fully operational and permanent commercial office in the Province for which they are submitting an offer.
2.  The office must be open Monday to Friday for a minimum of 7.5 hours per day, excluding Statutory Holidays.
3.  There must be a minimum of 2 full-time employees working in the office of the Province for which they are submitting an offer.
4.  The Offeror must describe the tools or procedures in place to test for the various skills and aptitudes for the type(s) of temporary help services category(ies) offered.
5.  The Offeror must describe their internal quality control process to evaluate overall service and the performance of the temporary help employees.

### Additional Information

The procurement includes a Point Rated Criteria for the Preferential Margin for Greening, Accessibility, and Social Commitments.

Should the submission of response to Greening, Accessibility, and Social Commitments be included, the Preferential Margin will only be applied if the supporting information submitted by the Offeror is deemed acceptable by Canada.

Delivery Date: Dec 1, 2022 to May 31, 2023, with the irrevocable right to extend for 2 additional one-year periods.

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
